The hull was breached, instantly sucking Maw into the vacuum of space. Strange was inadvertently caught in the vacuum, and the Cloak of Levitation attempted to rescue him. Leaping in, [Spider-Man](/wiki/Spider-Man) managed to grab Strange. Stark noted that the Ship was on an automated course bound for an [unknown location](/wiki/Titan). Strange insisted that Stark commandeer the Ship to return them and the Time Stone to [Earth](/wiki/Earth), although Stark was reluctant. Instead, he suggested continuing on their current course to Thanos, proposing they ambush him on his territory, where he would not be expecting an attack, and to keep his attention away from Earth. Although initially at odds, Strange reluctantly agreed with Stark's plan, after he told of his history over the years about Thanos' manipulative discourse. After agreeing, Strange reminded Stark that he would prioritize saving the Time Stone over either Stark or Parker's lives, asserting he would easily let either of them die if it means keeping the Stone from Thanos' hands. [[2]](#cite_note-AIW-2) Encountering the Guardians[ ] - "I went [forward in time](/wiki/Time_Travel), to view alternate futures, to see all the possible outcomes of the coming conflict." "How many did you see?" "Fourteen million, six hundred five." - Doctor Strange and [[src]](/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War) Crashing on [Titan](/wiki/Titan), battled Quill](/wiki/Peter_Quill), and [Mantis](/wiki/Mantis), believing them to be [Thanos](/wiki/Thanos)' soldiers. However, after a tense standoff, both parties realized they shared the same goal, before deciding to work together to ambush Thanos, who they expected to be arriving soon. Awaiting for Thanos' arrival, Iron Man, Spider-Man and the [Guardians of the Galaxy](/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy) attempted to formulate a plan of attack, while this happened, Strange activated the Time Stone, and just as he had done with [Dormammu](/wiki/Dormammu), [[15]](#cite_note-WIREDRussos-15) Strange created a time loop living 14,000,605 [[2]](#cite_note-AIW-2) possible scenarios. While reliving all the possible outcomes, [[15]](#cite_note-WIREDRussos-15) Strange contemplated cutting off Thanos' hand with his [Sling Ring](/wiki/Sling_Ring), but desisted upon realizing that the Titan's skin was almost impenetrable and that if he failed to cut it on time, Thanos would still be able to snap his fingers and accomplish his goal. [[16]](#cite_note-Russo_AMA-16) Strange eventually saw that the singular way to victory that involved Thanos obtaining all six Infinity Stones and achieving his goal of [culling](/wiki/Snap) the universe, with him among the casualties, however, in [2023](/wiki/2023), with the help of [Ant-Man](/wiki/Ant-Man), Stark, and the Avengers, they would perform a [Time Heist](/wiki/Time_Heist) that would allow them to create their [own Infinity Gauntlet](/wiki/Nano_Gauntlet) and have Banner successfully [resurrect](/wiki/Blip) the victims of the Snap back to life. Despite seeing that the defeat of [Thanos](/wiki/Thanos) would happen only with the [sacrifice](/wiki/Battle_of_Earth) of Stark, [[5]](#cite_note-AE-5) Strange returned to reality, and gravely informed the others of how many scenarios he had seen and that only one of them ended in Thanos' defeat, but did not inform them of any of the details. [[2]](#cite_note-AIW-2) [Battle of Titan](/wiki/Battle_of_Titan)[ ] Prior to the battle, Strange removed the [Time Stone](/wiki/Time_Stone) from the [Eye of Agamotto](/wiki/Eye_of_Agamotto) and hid both artifacts while creating a replica Eye to wear. Sitting down on a faraway hill alone, Strange saw [Thanos](/wiki/Thanos) and informed him that he had been brought face-to-face with a [Master of the Mystic Arts](/wiki/Masters_of_the_Mystic_Arts). Thanos ignored the threat, simply asking Strange where he believed [Ebony Maw](/wiki/Ebony_Maw) had brought him. Strange guessed that [Titan](/wiki/Titan) was his former home. Nodding wistfully in affirmation to Strange, Thanos stopped and began to reminisce. Thanos would use the [Reality Stone](/wiki/Reality_Stone) to craft an illusion of Titan's former beauty to Strange. Strange hailed Thanos as a prophet, but Thanos retorted, claiming himself to be a survivor. Strange continued to condemn the Titan's motivations as for [mass murdering](/wiki/Snap) trillions. Thanos explained to Strange that with all six [Infinity Stones](/wiki/Infinity_Stones), a single snap of his finger would only cause a merciful cessation of half of the universe's existence. Strange stood and questioned Thanos about once he achieved his goal. Thanos desired to simply rest while watching the sunrise on a grateful Universe. Threatening Thanos, Strange entered a combat stance, warning Thanos that their will would be equal to his. Realizing that Strange was not alone, Thanos was temporarily ambushed, only to begin attacking. Strange conjured a sword and engaged the half-blinded Thanos in brief close combat alongside [Drax the Destroyer](/wiki/Drax_the_Destroyer). However, Thanos would kick Strange in which he blocked it with a [Tao Mandala](/wiki/Tao_Mandalas). Strange would conjured platforms of energy for [Star-Lord](/wiki/Star-Lord) to jump and conjured a [portal](/wiki/Inter-Dimensional_Portal) for Star-Lord to escape. Strange would tell the [Cloak of Levitation](/wiki/Cloak_of_Levitation) to not allow Thanos to close his fist, then the Cloak would wrap around the Infinity Gauntlet and prevent Thanos from activating it. Using his [Sling Ring](/wiki/Sling_Ring), Strange summoned [Spider-Man](/wiki/Spider-Man) to attack Thanos, leaping through conjured portals to repeatedly attack Thanos from all sides and preventing him from removing the Cloak. However, once Thanos managed to grab Spider-Man, he would throw him towards Strange, knocking them both to the ground. Recovered from his harmful attack, Strange quickly cast a binding spell on Thanos, restraining the Gauntlet with crimson bands of energy. Until [Iron Man](/wiki/Iron_Man) swooped in, taking Strange's place to hold the Gauntlet. Strange used his [Sling Ring](/wiki/Sling_Ring) to open a portal and drop [Mantis](/wiki/Mantis) on Thanos' head, before casting the Bands to restrain his right arm. [[2]](#cite_note-AIW-2) Showdown with Thanos[ ] - "You're full of tricks, wizard. Yet you never once used your [greatest weapon](/wiki/Time_Stone). A [fake](/wiki/Eye_of_Agamotto)." - [Thanos](/wiki/Thanos)to Doctor Strange [[src]](/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War) Following the failed attempt of getting the [Infinity Gauntlet](/wiki/Infinity_Gauntlet) off, Strange personally confronted [Thanos](/wiki/Thanos) in a ferocious duel, with Strange launching the first strike, sending streams of energy at Thanos. Leaping into the air, Thanos retaliated with a blast of energy from the [Power Stone](/wiki/Power_Stone). Strange countered with an open gateway to the [Mirror Dimension](/wiki/Mirror_Dimension) to absorb the beam, before pushing it toward Thanos to trap him. Thanos destroyed the gateway with the Power Stone, before throwing the remnants back at Strange in the form of a black hole with the [Space Stone](/wiki/Space_Stone). Thinking quickly, Strange cast a spell to transmute the singularity into a swarm of blue butterflies, briefly confusing Thanos. Raising into the air with the [Cloak of Levitation](/wiki/Cloak_of_Levitation), Strange then cast his duplication spell, splitting into an army of magical clones of himself to restrain Thanos with hundreds of [Eldritch Whips](/wiki/Magic). However, Thanos immediately regained the upper hand, activating the [Soul](/wiki/Soul_Stone) and Power Stones to instantly destroy the false images and briefly sunder Strange's [astral form](/wiki/Astral_Dimension) from his body. With his opponent staggered, Thanos activated the Space and [Reality Stones](/wiki/Reality_Stone), pulling Strange to his hand before he could react, winning the duel. Once he was subdued, Strange was within Thanos' grasp and tried to pull himself away. Admitting that while he was impressed by Strange's mastery over [magic](/wiki/Magic), Thanos deduced that, as the sorcerer had never once attempted to use the [Time Stone](/wiki/Time_Stone) to his advantage, the [Eye of Agamotto](/wiki/Eye_of_Agamotto) that was being worn was a fake. Confirming his suspicions, Thanos took and crushed the fake Eye of Agamotto, revealing it to be empty, before throwing Strange away. [[2]](#cite_note-AIW-2) [Thanos' Victory](/wiki/Snap)[ ] - "Tony. There was no other - Doctor Strange to [Tony Stark](/wiki/Tony_Stark) [[src]](/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War) Before [Thanos](/wiki/Thanos) could kill [Iron Man](/wiki/Iron_Man), Strange intervened and offered the Time Stone in exchange for Stark's life, [[2]](#cite_note-AIW-2) since his future vision revealed to him that Stark needed to live to convert [Hank Pym](/wiki/Hank_Pym)'s [Quantum Tunnel](/wiki/Quantum_Tunnel) into a time machine for the [Time Heist](/wiki/Time_Heist) and sacrifice himself at the [Battle of Earth](/wiki/Battle_of_Earth) to defeat Thanos. [[5]](#cite_note-AE-5) Thanos agreed after warning Strange not to double-cross him. Despite Stark's pleas to not give in, Strange revealed the Time Stone, having disguised it as a star in Titan's sky, and surrendered it to Thanos. After the battle, Stark would ask Strange why he would give up the Stone. Strange could only inform Stark that they were now in the "endgame." When Thanos collected the last remaining stone, the [Mind Stone](/wiki/Mind_Stone), from [Vision](/wiki/Vision) in [Wakanda](/wiki/Wakanda), he snapped his fingers, removing half of sapient life in the universe from existence. After watching [Mantis](/wiki/Mantis), [Drax](/wiki/Drax), and [Star-Lord](/wiki/Star-Lord) vanish before their eyes, Strange, gradually disintegrating into dust himself, assured a visibly-shaken Stark that there was no other way before disappearing. [[2]](#cite_note-AIW-2) With no Sorcerer Supreme since 2017, the position had been left vacant with Strange as a candidate [[17]](#cite_note-Empire_MoM-17), but with Strange dead, the title of Sorcerer Supreme was given to Wong. [[13]](#cite_note-SMNWH-13) [Battle of Earth](/wiki/Battle_of_Earth)[ ] [Five years later](/wiki/2023), as a result of the [Blip](/wiki/Blip), Strange was restored to life. Knowing what had transpired during the five years due to looking into the future with the [Eye of Agamotto](/wiki/Eye_of_Agamotto), Strange enlisted the assistance of [Spider-Man](/wiki/Spider-Man) and the [Guardians of the Galaxy](/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy). He then opened a [portal](/wiki/Inter-Dimensional_Portal) from Titan to [Earth](/wiki/Earth) and arrived at the destroyed [Avengers Compound](/wiki/Avengers_Compound) to prepare for the [massive battle](/wiki/Battle_of_Earth) against [alternate Thanos](/wiki/Thanos/Cosmic_Time_Heist). He then began recruiting [Wong](/wiki/Wong) and the other [Masters of the Mystic Arts](/wiki/Masters_of_the_Mystic_Arts) to find every hero who was resurrected in order for them to assist the surviving [Avengers](/wiki/Avengers) in the fight. After seeing Wong in person, he inquired if they were able to summon everyone, to which Wong exasperatedly asked Strange if he wanted more. Strange then stood alongside the epic line of assembled heroes as [Captain America](/wiki/Steve_Rogers) led the charge against alternate Thanos and his army. Strange then charged towards Thanos' army, using the [Cloak of Levitation](/wiki/Cloak_of_Levitation) to fly into the air and into battle. After taking down a group of aliens with magic into another dimension, Strange was approached by [Tony Stark](/wiki/Tony_Stark), who questioned if this was the one out of fourteen million futures in which they would win. Strange told Stark that if he told him what happens, it won't happen. Stark then told Strange that he had better be right. When Thanos ordered an airstrike to halt [Wanda Maximoff](/wiki/Wanda_Maximoff)'s attacks, it destroyed the foundations of the nearby lake. When [Pepper Potts](/wiki/Pepper_Potts) called this to attention, Strange stepped up to hold back the water from reaching the battlefield. Strange continued to hold back the water after alternate Thanos had destroyed [Luis](/wiki/Luis)' [van](/wiki/Luis%27_Van) with his [sword](/wiki/Double-Edged_Sword). After seeing [Carol Danvers](/wiki/Carol_Danvers) get knocked out of the fight by alternate Thanos, Strange, visibly shocked, signaled to Stark that this was the one timeline he foresaw where they won and nudged him to act. This ultimately led to Stark sacrificing himself by stealing away the [Infinity Stones](/wiki/Infinity_Stones) and using them to wipe out alternate Thanos and his army, which proved Strange's visions correct. [[5]](#cite_note-AE-5) All the heroes then gathered around the fallen hero, and following [Clint Barton](/wiki/Clint_Barton), everyone, including Strange, knelt before him out of respect. [[18]](#cite_note-AE-DS-18) Tony Stark's Funeral[ ] A week later, Strange and [Wong](/wiki/Wong) attended [Tony Stark](/wiki/Tony_Stark)'s funeral at the [Stark Eco-Compound](/wiki/Stark_Eco-Compound). Strange and Wong stood alongside all the heroes who they previously fought with, as Stark's [Arc Reactor](/wiki/Arc_Reactor) was sent adrift on the lake. [[5]](#cite_note-AE-5) Afterwards, Strange returned to live at the [New York Sanctum](/wiki/New_York_Sanctum). [[13]](#cite_note-SMNWH-13) "Friendship" with [Battle of Earth](/wiki/Battle_of_Earth), [Scott Lang](/wiki/Scott_Lang) struck up a friendship with various [Avengers](/wiki/Avengers), as well as other heros. Strange was one of those heroes, as he attempted to befriend Strange, however, Strange did not reciprocate the attempts at friendship, dismising Lang. After Lang was later nominated to write a book about the events surrounding the [Blip](/wiki/Blip) and [Thanos](/wiki/Thanos/Cosmic_Time_Heist)' defeat, titled [Look Out for the Little Guy!](/wiki/Look_Out_for_the_Little_Guy!). Strange was given a copy of the book to read and enjoyed it. Strange's review was then featured on the back of the book alongside [Bruce Banner](/wiki/Bruce_Banner)'s and [Captain America](/wiki/Captain_America)'s. The review said that although he was not hoping for Lang to write a book, he still enjoyed reading it. [[19]](#cite_note-LOFTLG-19) [Multiversal Crisis](/wiki/Spider-Man_Multiversal_Crisis)[ ] Helping Peter Parker[ ] - "You know, after everything we've been through together, somehow I always forget... You're just a kid. Look, part of the problem, it's not [Mysterio](/wiki/Mysterio). It's you. Trying to live two different lives." - Doctor Strange to [Peter Parker](/wiki/Peter_Parker) [[src]](/wiki/Spider-Man:_No_Way_Home) In [2024](/wiki/2024), Strange witnessed a blizzard in [Siberia](/wiki/Siberia) come through the [Rotunda of Gateways](/wiki/Rotunda_of_Gateways) into the [New York Sanctum](/wiki/New_York_Sanctum). That November, he was visited by [Peter Parker](/wiki/Peter_Parker), who was surprised to learn that Strange was not Sorcerer Supreme and that [Wong](/wiki/Wong) had been given the title. Strange asked what the reason for the visit was and insisted that Parker no longer refer to him as "sir" due to their shared experiences. Parker brought up that [Mysterio](/wiki/Mysterio) revealing his identity to the world ruined his life, and asked if Strange could go back in time and stop it from happening. As Parker pled his case, Strange informed him that he was no longer in possession of the [Time Stone](/wiki/Time_Stone) and voiced his concerns that the recent [Time Heist](/wiki/Time_Heist) affected the space-time continuum, but was given the idea to cast a [spell](/wiki/Runes_of_Kof-Kol) that would make everyone forget Parker was Spider-Man. Wong objected Strange's idea, as it traveled the borders of known and unknown realities, but Strange revealed he had used the spell for less important matters, such as a party at [Kamar-Taj](/wiki/Kamar-Taj). Strange attempted to convince Wong, who decided to let it happen, only if he were to be left out of the entire situation, and he departed through an [Inter-Dimensional Portal](/wiki/Inter-Dimensional_Portal) to Kamar-Taj. Strange brought Parker down to the Sanctum's lower level to a room that had walls that were thousands of years old and were filled with cosmic energy currents. As he began to cast the spell, he said a farewell to Parker, as he would soon forget who he was. Parker questioned what Strange meant, who revealed that the spell would make everyone in the world forget, and that it would be dangerous to change while casting the spell. However, Strange decided to allow Parker's [girlfriend](/wiki/Michelle_Jones) to remember, but Parker continued to add a [few](/wiki/Ned_Leeds) [more](/wiki/May_Parker) [people](/wiki/Happy_Hogan) as he wanted not to forget him, even after Strange insisted on not altering it further, which caused him to start losing control of the spell. Due to the interference, the spell erupted around them, creating a fissure in the [Multiverse](/wiki/Multiverse), with Parker changing again it so that only people that knew he was Spider-Man before the reveal would know, so Strange quickly shut it down before chaos ensued and stored it inside the [Macchina di Kadavus](/wiki/Macchina_di_Kadavus). Annoyed that his spell was changed, Strange angrily told Parker that it did not work, and explained that the problem was him trying to live two different lives. When Strange learnt that Parker tried to get him to brainwash the world before speaking to the people at [Massachusetts Institute of Technology](/wiki/Massachusetts_Institute_of_Technology), he promply removed him from the Sanctum. [[13]](#cite_note-SMNWH-13) Capturing Multiversal Visitors[ ] - "I thought you stopped the [spell](/wiki/Runes_of_Kof-Kol)?" "No, I contained it, but it would appear that a few of them squeaked through. After you left, I detected an otherworldly presence. I pursued it into the sewers, where I found that [slimy, green, son of a gun](/wiki/Lizard)." - [Peter Parker](/wiki/Peter_Parker)and Doctor Strange [[src]](/wiki/Spider-Man:_No_Way_Home) Soon after, Strange detected an other worldly presence, and went to investigate, finding [Lizard](/wiki/Lizard) in the sewers, so he put him in a cell under the Sanctum, realizing that the spell had caused people from the [Multiverse](/wiki/Multiverse) that knew Parker was Spider-Man to be brought over to their universe. Strange used his [Sling Ring](/wiki/Sling_Ring) to bring back Parker, who had encountered another one, [Doctor Octopus](/wiki/Doctor_Octopus), who Strange put in a cell also. He explained to Parker how he was only able to contain the spell, which is why a few people have managed to cross the Multiverse. Seeking to remedy the situation, Strange then tasked Parker with locating the rest and bringing them back to the Sanctum while he figured out a way to return them to their respective universes before they destroyed the fabric of reality. Strange upgraded Parker's [Spider-Man Suit](/wiki/Spider-Man_Suit) and [Web-Shooters](/wiki/Web-Shooters) with a [magic](/wiki/Magic) device so that he could transport any universe-displaced people directly to a cell in the Sanctum. Parker then told Strange that he would still help in finding the people, so Strange went to find Parker's friends. Strange found [Michelle Jones](/wiki/Michelle_Jones) and [Ned Leeds](/wiki/Ned_Leeds), and brought them to the Sanctum, where they asked about how the people got to their universe, so Strange explained how Parker's attempts to get them all into college led to the spell that went wrong. Wanting to get the problem over with, Strange reminded them to get to work and start looking for any more trespassers from the Multiverse. However, after Jones called him out for being the one that messed up the spell, Strange sees her point and told them to get to work, allowing them to use the undercroft. [[13]](#cite_note-SMNWH-13) [Conflict with Spider-Man](/wiki/Battle_for_the_Macchina_di_Kadavus)[ ] - "Parker, don't you realize that in the [Multiverse](/wiki/Multiverse), there are an infinite number of people who know Peter Parker is Spider-Man. And if that [spell](/wiki/Runes_of_Kof-Kol)gets loose, they're all coming here." - Doctor Strange to [Spider-Man](/wiki/Spider-Man) [[src]](/wiki/Spider-Man:_No_Way_Home) Later, Strange returned to the Sanctum's undercroft and saw that [Sandman](/wiki/Flint_Marko) and [Electro](/wiki/Electro) had been added into the cells. He then spotted [Norman Osborn](/wiki/Norman_Osborn) and transported him into a cell. He revealed that he had used the [Macchina di Kadavus](/wiki/Macchina_di_Kadavus), an ancient relic to trap the corrupted spell, and only needed to complete the ritual to reverse what had been done. Parker told Strange not to go through with the plan, as it meant sending them to their deaths, but Strange was adamant on upholding their fates, so he began the ritual to send them back. Before Strange could complete the ritual, Parker snatched the [Macchina di Kadavus](/wiki/Macchina_di_Kadavus) away from him, and used his upgraded gauntlet to put Strange in a cell with Sandman, as he ran away. Strange was able to walk out of the cell, and followed Parker outside the Sanctum, using an [Inter-Dimensional Portal](/wiki/Inter-Dimensional_Portal) to prevent him from leaving. Strange removed the gauntlet from Parker, and pushed his [astral form](/wiki/Astral_Dimension) out of his body, but was unable to take back the Macchina due to Parker's Spider-Sense. Parker managed to return to his physical body, and began swinging away, so Strange sent the [Cloak of Levitation](/wiki/Cloak_of_Levitation) after him, allowing Strange to open the [Mirror Dimension](/wiki/Mirror_Dimension) and put Parker in it. Being in complete control in the Mirror Dimension, Strange manipulated the environment as he pursued Spider-Man, leading to them facing off on top of a train in [Central Park](/wiki/Central_Park). Strange told Spider-Man that the spell could not get loose as an infinite number of people would cross into their universe, but Spider-Man was determined to change the fate before sending them back. Strange opened a portal above and below Spider-Man, causing him to fall endlessly with the Cloak grabbing the Macchina. Parker collided the two portals into each other, making the Mirror Dimension alter around them and making them appear by the [Grand Canyon](/wiki/Grand_Canyon) in [Arizona](/wiki/Arizona). The Macchina fell, so Strange flew after it. Strange retrieved the Macchina and opened a portal out of the Mirror Dimension. Spider-Man used his knowledge of geometry to [web](/wiki/Synthetic_Webbing) Strange up. As he boasted that math was cooler than magic, Spider-Man took the Macchina and then used his webs to take Strange's [Sling Ring](/wiki/Sling_Ring). He then went through the portal, leaving Strange tied up in the Mirror Dimension. [[13]](#cite_note-SMNWH-13) [Battle at Liberty Island](/wiki/Battle_at_Liberty_Island)[ ] - "Everyone who knows and loves you, we... we'd have no memory of you. It would be as though you never existed." "I know. Do it." - Doctor Strange and [Spider-Man](/wiki/Spider-Man) [[src]](/wiki/Spider-Man:_No_Way_Home) After being stuck in the [Grand Canyon](/wiki/Grand_Canyon) within the [Mirror Dimension](/wiki/Mirror_Dimension) for twelve hours, Strange managed to escape and come through an [Inter-Dimensional Portal](/wiki/Inter-Dimensional_Portal) that was inadvertently opened up by [Ned Leeds](/wiki/Ned_Leeds) to the [Statue of Liberty](/wiki/Statue_of_Liberty). Being greeted by Leeds and [Michelle Jones](/wiki/Michelle_Jones), Strange asked them where Parker was then reclaimed his [Sling Ring](/wiki/Sling_Ring) and the [Macchina di Kadavus](/wiki/Macchina_di_Kadavus). However, before he could do anything else, Strange was informed by Leeds and Jones that Parker's plan to cure the universe-displaced people was working, as they witnessed [Lizard](/wiki/Lizard) turning back into a human. Seeing this, Strange realized that Parker was right about second chances and was right about him not having a heart before. Strange then asked Leeds if he was the one who opened the portal as he replied that he did. Hearing this, Strange was impressed by Leeds as he nod his head in approval then left to go to the top of the Statue of Liberty. Strange went to confront Parker, who introduced him to his [two](/wiki/Friendly_Neighborhood_Spider-Man) [counterparts](/wiki/Amazing_Spider-Man) from other universes, and reminded him that they had to send everyone back. But at that moment, [Green Goblin](/wiki/Green_Goblin) attacked them with his [Razor Bats](/wiki/Razor_Bats), with Octavius narrowly saving Strange and snatched the Macchina, so Strange used an [Eldritch Whip](/wiki/Eldritch_Whip) to get it back, only to find a [Pumpkin Bomb](/wiki/Pumpkin_Bombs) had been placed inside of it. With the Macchina destroyed, the unstable spell became loose, and despite Strange's efforts to contain it again, he could not, and the [Multiverse](/wiki/Multiverse) started to crack open. Strange used his magic to close the cracks, but the spell could not be stopped. Parker suggested to cast the spell again how it was meant to be done, but Strange stated that it was too late, as infinite amounts of people from the Multiverse were coming through because of him. Parker then told Strange to cast a new spell to make everyone forget who he was. Strange became slightly emotional and was reluctant however, warning Parker of the severity of the spell, but he accepted it, so Strange told him to say his goodbyes and began casting the spell, but not before they both bid farewell to one another themselves. The spell worked and the universe-displaced were sent back to their universes, along with the infinite number of people, and everyone in his universe forgot Parker's existence, including Strange himself. [[13]](#cite_note-SMNWH-13) Dreams[ ] - "Last night, you were in my dream." "That wasn't a dream. It was another universe." - Doctor Strange and [America Chavez](/wiki/America_Chavez) [[src]](/wiki/Doctor_Strange_in_the_Multiverse_of_Madness) A short time later, Strange dreamt of a young [girl](/wiki/America_Chavez) and an [alternate version](/wiki/Doctor_Strange/Defender_Strange) of himself running from a [ribboned creature](/wiki/Ribboned_Creature) in an [unknown location](/wiki/Gap_Junction). The creature ended up killing the alternate version of himself and tried to capture the girl, but she opened up a star-shaped portal that caused her and the deceased Strange to fall through. Strange suddenly woke up breathing hard in his bed at the [New York Sanctum](/wiki/New_York_Sanctum). After looking around to calm himself, he grabbed his wrist watch. [[3]](#cite_note-DSitMoM-3) Christine Palmer's Wedding[ ] - "It was never gonna work out between us." "Why not?" "Because, Stephen... You have to be the one holding the knife. And I always respected you for it, but I couldn't love you for it." - [Christine Palmer](/wiki/Christine_Palmer)and Stephen Strange [[src]](/wiki/Doctor_Strange_in_the_Multiverse_of_Madness) Strange then got dressed before a mirror, but when he attempted to use his hands to tie his tie, he short cuffed it and used his [Magic](/wiki/Magic) to do so. He put his [Cloak of Levitation](/wiki/Cloak_of_Levitation) inside his suit front pocket and then left the Sanctum and arrived at a nearby church, where he had been invited to attend [Christine Palmer](/wiki/Christine_Palmer)'s wedding. Strange then took his seat in a pew and was pleasantly surprised when [Nicodemus West](/wiki/Nicodemus_West) came in and sat beside him. West told Strange he hadn't seen him in awhile, in which Strange remarked that he had [disappeared](/wiki/Snap) for five years. West acknowledged that and remarked that he too had been a victim of the [Blip](/wiki/Blip). He then asked Strange if he was right with his actions in the [Infinity War](/wiki/Infinity_War) in that there was only one way to defeat [Thanos](/wiki/Thanos). Strange reassured him of this, stating there was only one way. West told him that ever since he had been restored to life he had been wondering if there was any other way as to have avoided the [Snap](/wiki/Snap). He told Strange that he had lost his two pet [cats](/wiki/Cats) and brother in the time he was gone. Strange expressed his condolences and understood how emotional the event had been. Strange then saw Palmer walk inside as the wedding began. As flower girls threw up flowers as she entered, Strange held his composure, albeit was emotional upon seeing her get married to someone else. After the ceremony, Strange was invited to the reception. While there, he encountered Palmer at the bar, and he used magic to fill her glass with wine. He then congratulated her on her wedding, and she told him that her [husband](/wiki/Charlie_(Husband)) was a fan of his. Strange told Palmer that he wished things could have been different, but he had to make sacrifices. Palmer responded that it would never have worked out with them due to his personality. Strange claimed that he was glad she was happy, and when Palmer asked if he was happy, Strange told her he was, although not as happy as he wanted to be. She then excused herself to tend to her guests. [[3]](#cite_note-DSitMoM-3) [Battle Against Gargantos](/wiki/Chase_of_America_Chavez)[ ] - "Look, I left a very nice wedding to save a smartass kid from getting eaten by an [octopus](/wiki/Gargantos)." - Doctor Strange to [America Chavez](/wiki/America_Chavez) [[src]](/wiki/Doctor_Strange_in_the_Multiverse_of_Madness) Strange sipped his glass only to hear a car crash outside and people screaming. As guests rushed to the balcony to see what was going on, Strange followed. Upon seeing that there was chaos in the streets, Strange handed his glass to the bartender and took out the [Cloak of Levitation](/wiki/Cloak_of_Levitation) out of his suit pocket and leaped off the balcony, changing into his sorcerer's suit. Strange pursued where the chaos was coming from, witnessing a woman nearly get knocked over. He put up protective shields and used his [magic](/wiki/Magic) to conjure giant hands to help him try and stop the invisible creature. Strange descended onto the street and watched as a [girl](/wiki/America_Chavez) hopped onto a bus. After seeing that the girl was the same person from his dream, he became confused. When the bus was lifted off the ground, Strange became more confused but then used his magic to release the invisibility surrounding it and exposed [Gargantos](/wiki/Gargantos), a one-eyed tentacled inter-dimensional creature. Strange used his magic to slice off one of Gargantos's tentacles in order for him to release the bus. As the girl fell out of the bus, the Cloak went and saved her, bringing her back to Strange. Strange turned to talk to her, but she told him to look out as the bus was thrown back at him. Strange used his powers to slice the bus in half and keep it from hitting them. He then turned around and asked the girl who she was before getting swatted aside by Gargantos, who knocked him into [Jonas & James](/wiki/Jonas_%26_James) where he was knocked unconscious. When Strange regained consciousness, he found that his Cloak was missing. He then hopped onto a taxi and observed what was happening. He saw [Wong](/wiki/Wong) had arrived, but was held within Gargantos' grasp. Strange conjured an ax and threw it at the tentacle releasing Wong. Strange told him he was welcome, while Wong stated that it was custom to bow before the Sorcerer Supreme, and Strange said he was fully aware of the customs. Strange and Wong then used [Eldritch Whips](/wiki/Eldritch_Whip) to grab onto Gargantos, who was still chasing the girl. The girl had been taken onto a high rise building and Gargantos was scaling the building to get to her. Strange used his magic to knock away its tentacle as it tried to grab the girl. However, this didn't work, and Gargantos knocked aside Wong and grabbed Strange. The Cloak arrived and covered Gargantos' eye as Strange used the giant hands to lift up a nearby lamppost. The Cloak removed itself just as Strange forced the lamppost into Gargantos's eyeball. He then used the giant hand to pull the lamppost out taking the whole eyeball with it. Strange was released and the now dead Gargantos fell to the street below. [[3]](#cite_note-DSitMoM-3) Meeting the Multiversal Traveler[ ] - "How much experience do you [guys](/wiki/Wong)have with the [Multiverse](/wiki/Multiverse)?" "We have experience of the Multiverse. Most recently, there was an [incident](/wiki/Spider-Man_Multiversal_Crisis)with [Spider-Man](/wiki/Spider-Man)." - [America Chavez](/wiki/America_Chavez)and Doctor Strange [[src]](/wiki/Doctor_Strange_in_the_Multiverse_of_Madness) Afterwards, Strange and [Wong](/wiki/Wong) demanded answers from the [girl](/wiki/America_Chavez). However, she ran away from them and Strange realised she had taken his [Sling Ring](/wiki/Sling_Ring). Wong then used his Sling Ring to transport them to where was. Cornered, the girl was forced to speak to them and told them she could travel the [Multiverse](/wiki/Multiverse). Strange and Wong decided to take the girl to [Mancini's Pizzeria](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mancini%27s_Pizzeria) where they could learn more about her. The girl asked them if they had any experience with the Multiverse. Strange told her that they did in an [event](/wiki/Spider-Man_Multiversal_Crisis) recently with [Spider-Man](/wiki/Spider-Man). The girl asked if Spider-Man looked like a spider and had the powers of a [spider](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/spider) but Strange told her more of a man. The girl asked where his [webs](/wiki/Synthetic_Webbing) came out of and Strange stated he had [Web-Shooters](/wiki/Web-Shooters). The girl then commented that the pizza was really good and that her stomach may be different as she was from another universe. Strange then asked her why she was being chased by creatures. The girl then told them about Strange's [variant](/wiki/Doctor_Strange/Defender_Strange) and how he had betrayed her, after which Strange stated he was in his dream as well. However, the girl told him it wasn't a dream. She said they were searching for a book of pure magic and Strange deduced it was the [Book of Vishanti](/wiki/Book_of_Vishanti), which he stated was not real. Wong told him it was but was unreachable. The girl said she had found it though. Strange then told the girl to prove that what she was saying wasn't a dream. She took them to a building's rooftop and showed them Strange's variant's corpse. When asked what should happen to the body as it would break violations, Strange used his magic to lift the body and place it a block of dirt. He then said he had buried worse. Wong asked the girl what her name was and she introduced herself as [America Chavez](/wiki/America_Chavez). She was invited to [Kamar-Taj](/wiki/Kamar-Taj) and Strange then noted that the symbols on [Gargantos](/wiki/Gargantos) and the variant weren't of sorcery and were of witchcraft. When Wong asked who could know such a thing, Strange told them he knew of [someone](/wiki/Scarlet_Witch) who could help. [[3]](#cite_note-DSitMoM-3) [More Multiversal Problems](/wiki/Scarlet_Witch%27s_War)[ ] Meeting with Wanda Maximoff[ ] - "Well, you can kiss the lunch box goodbye, because that's the kind of justification our enemies use." "Is it the one you used when you gave [Thanos](/wiki/Thanos)the [Time Stone](/wiki/Time_Stone)?" "That was a [war](/wiki/Infinity_War), and I did what I had to do." - Doctor Strange and [Scarlet Witch](/wiki/Scarlet_Witch) [[src]](/wiki/Doctor_Strange_in_the_Multiverse_of_Madness) Strange travelled to [Wanda Maximoff](/wiki/Wanda_Maximoff)'s location and found her living in a [cabin](/wiki/Wanda_Maximoff%27s_Hideout). He approached her as she was gardening and asked her if the apples were real and she told him that they were very real. She assumed that he was there to talk about [Westview](/wiki/Westview), but he told her that he wasn't there to talk about Westview, acknowledging that Maximoff had done the right thing and taken down her [Hex](/wiki/Westview_Anomaly) as he thought she would. Strange then asked her what she knew of the [Multiverse](/wiki/Multiverse). They went walking and she told him that [Vision](/wiki/Vision) believed it to be real and dangerous. Strange stated that he was right. Strange then told her that a [girl](/wiki/America_Chavez) had arrived and was being chased by [creatures](/wiki/Gargantos). He told Maximoff that he needed her help as she was an [Avenger](/wiki/Avengers), but she said there were others he could ask. Strange told her that between [Hawkeye](/wiki/Hawkeye), [Ant-Man](/wiki/Ant-Man), [Wasp](/wiki/Wasp), and [Spider-Man](/wiki/Spider-Man), she was the only logical answer. He offered Maximoff to come to [Kamar-Taj](/wiki/Kamar-Taj), but she suggested that he bring [America Chavez](/wiki/America_Chavez) to her instesd, causing Strange to pause and stop walking. Beginning to deduce that Maximoff knew more than she let on, he became disappointed. When Maximoff saw that Strange had figured it out, she told him that the Hex was easy but lying not so much. She then removed the illusion surrounding the field, revealing a barren desolate landscape. Strange then saw Maximoff's Scarlet Witch uniform and watched as she summoned the [Darkhold](/wiki/Darkhold). He recognised it and pondered what it had done to Maximoff, knowing its corrupting powers. Maximoff told him that it merely revealed the truth that her [two](/wiki/Tommy_Maximoff) [children](/wiki/Billy_Maximoff) were alive and that she was planning on escaping to an alternate universe to be with them. Strange retorted that she had created her children and they weren't real. He said that what she was going to do was breaking every law of reality, but she told him that taking Chavez's powers was for the greater good. Strange replied that her reasoning was the same justification for their enemies, but she countered saying that Strange was contradictory, noting how he gave the [Time Stone](/wiki/Time_Stone) to [Thanos](/wiki/Thanos). Strange told her that that was a [war](/wiki/Infinity_War) and he had no choice. She then told him to go back to Kamar-Taj and prepare to hand over Chavez by sundown. As she walked away, he asked her what would happen if they didn't and she told him that they would meet the Scarlet Witch. [[3]](#cite_note-DSitMoM-3) [Siege of Kamar-Taj](/wiki/Siege_of_Kamar-Taj)[ ] - "Wanda, you are justifiably angry. You had to make terrible sacrifices." "I blew a hole through the head of the [man](/wiki/Vision)I loved. And it meant nothing. Do not speak to me of sacrifice, Stephen Strange." - Doctor Strange and [Scarlet Witch](/wiki/Scarlet_Witch) [[src]](/wiki/Doctor_Strange_in_the_Multiverse_of_Madness) Strange returned [Kamar-Taj](/wiki/Kamar-Taj) and told Chavez](/wiki/America_Chavez), and other [Masters of the Mystic Arts](/wiki/Masters_of_the_Mystic_Arts) that the [Darkhold](/wiki/Darkhold) has control over [Wanda Maximoff](/wiki/Wanda_Maximoff) and that she was coming from Chavez. Wong explained how powerful the Scarlet Witch was and Strange noted that she had used her mind to take over a whole [town](/wiki/Westview). Chavez looked at him suspiciously noting that the person he had gone to ask for help was the same person after her. Strange then prepared as Wong ordered Kamar-Taj to become a fortress. After the students and Masters went out to defend Kamar-Taj, Strange and Wong joined them. They watched as a large dark cloud rolled in, soon covering the atmosphere in darkness. Strange then looked up and saw Maximoff flying within the clouds. As he was to speak to her, Wong told him to choose his words wisely. Strange then flew up to speak with her as the clouds dissipated. Maximoff told him that all she wanted was them to hand over Chavez. Strange told her they couldn't do that and when he mentioned sacrifices, Maximoff became angry. She stated that she had sacrificed everything, mentioning how she had used her powers to destroy [Vision](/wiki/Vision), but that meant nothing as the [Snap](/wiki/Snap) still happened. Maximoff moved closer and asked him to sympathise with her, asking if there was a universe where he could be happy with [Christine Palmer](/wiki/Christine_Palmer) wouldn't he go there. Strange refused to do so, and Maximoff told him to remember that what she did next was reasonable. Maximoff shot a blast of her [chaos magic](/wiki/Magic) at him, but the protective shields surrounding the perimeter blocked her. Strange then descended down to stand by Wong and the Masters. As Maximoff furiously tried to break the shields, Strange observed her actions. He then saw that she had stopped blasting the shield and was trying to use her telepathy. She was able to mind control a student in removing his shield allowing for her to break inside. Maximoff blasted buildings and Masters aside, creating fires in the courtyards. Her blasts were strong enough to cause Strange to clutch his side. He then told everyone to fall back, knowing that they couldn't stop her. When Wong stayed behind, Strange yelled at him to follow. Strange used a trap that he set up to stall Maximoff by trapping her in the [Mirror Dimension](/wiki/Mirror_Dimension). He and Wong met up with Chavez, who had been hiding in a room with [Hamir](/wiki/Hamir) and another Master. He told her they needed to get her out of there as Kamar-Taj had fallen. Suddenly, doors slammed shut around them and Hamir and the Master were taken away through puddles on the floor. Strange realized that Maximoff was using reflections to escape the Dimension and told them to cover them up. Along with Wong and Chavez, Strange covered the reflections. Despite their efforts, Maximoff emerged from a gong and demanded Strange hand over America . Strange attempted to talk some sense into Maximoff once more, by telling her that [her](/wiki/Tommy_Maximoff) [children](/wiki/Billy_Maximoff) don't exist. Maximoff insisted that Billy and Tommy were present in other universes, and proved her point by telling them she dreams about her sons, before showing them how happy her other variants were with their children. Strange and Chavez sadly watched the visions projected from the pages of the [Darkhold](/wiki/Darkhold), before the book closes and Maximoff states that "she wakes up to find herself in the same nightmare", referring to her world without her sons. Strange then asked that, if she were to reach her boys in another universe, what would happen to their mother, to which Maximoff responded by gritting her teeth angrily at him. Sensing an incoming attack, Strange unhesitatingly summoned several serpentine [dragons](/wiki/Dragons) to attack Maximoff, only for them to be finished off quickly and then get thrown aside into a pillar. Maximoff then defeated Wong and began to capture Chavez. Fortunately, as Maximoff began to absorb Chavez's power, the latter involuntarily opened one of her portals behind her. Strange took this as an opportunity to dive after her. In the process, Maximoff blasted a fiery ball of [chaos magic](/wiki/Magic), which burnt a hole in the [Cloak of Levitation](/wiki/Cloak_of_Levitation) as Strange and Chavez fell through the portal. "That's not my weird trip, kid." - [America Chavez](/wiki/America_Chavez)and Doctor Strange [[src]](/wiki/Doctor_Strange_in_the_Multiverse_of_Madness) Strange and Chavez then plummeted fast leaving his universe and entering several alternate universes, including among others. Strange and Chavez finally landed on the roof of a building in [New York City](/wiki/New_York_City) of Earth-838. Upon catching his breath, Strange asked Chavez if she was okay, to which she answered in amazement that he had saved her and was surprised that Strange did not vomit from the interdimensional trip. Strange recalled his first trip through the Multiverse that the [Ancient One](/wiki/Ancient_One) sent him on to Chavez, and was intrigued by the way New York looked like in the alternate universe, only to be interrupted by his own stomach, and rushed over to a nearby chimney to go vomit into it, much to Chavez's disgust. Mordo then revealed and explained how Maximoff seemed to be [Dreamwalking](/wiki/Dreamwalking), which meant that she could use the body of an alternate version of her. As Mordo explained, Strange started getting woozy. He looked over to Chavez who was passed out. Strange exclaimed to what he thought was his friend before he passed out himself.
